Package com.irurueta.geometry.io

Interface MeshWriterListener

All Known Subinterfaces:
MeshWriterJsonListener
public interface MeshWriterListener
Listener for a mesh writer. This listener will notify when writing starts, finishes, notifies progress changes, when textures need to be validated, when a chunk of data has been loaded, etc.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    onChunkAvailable(MeshWriter writer, DataChunk chunk)
    Called when a chunk of data is available.

    Called when a material file is needed.

  • Method Details

    • onWriteStart

      void onWriteStart(MeshWriter writer)
      Notifies when writing starts.
      Parameters:
      writer - reference to writer.

    • onWriteEnd

      void onWriteEnd(MeshWriter writer)
      Notifies when writing ends.
      Parameters:
      writer - reference to writer.

    • onWriteProgressChange

      void onWriteProgressChange(MeshWriter writer, float progress)
      Notifies progress changes during writing.
      Parameters:
      writer - reference to writer.
      progress - progress amount as a value between 0.0 and 1.0.

    • onChunkAvailable

      void onChunkAvailable(MeshWriter writer, DataChunk chunk)
      Called when a chunk of data is available.
      Parameters:
      writer - reference to writer.
      chunk - chunk of data that has been loaded.

    • onMaterialFileRequested

      File onMaterialFileRequested(MeshWriter writer, String path)
      Called when a material file is needed. A path used as a hint to locate such file will be provided, and using that path the File must be retrieved (by any means, such as downloading from a remote location or uncompressing from a file, etc.). Returned file will be handled by the callee of this method. If a temporary file is created copying the contents of the file from a remote location, then it will be the responsibility of the callee to delete the temporary file.
      Parameters:
      writer - reference to writer.
      path - path where material file is supposed to be found.
      Returns:
      File containing the material file.

    • onValidateTexture

      File onValidateTexture(MeshWriter writer, Texture texture)
      Called when a texture needs to be validated. Provided texture data will contain the path that can be used as a hint to locate the texture image. The texture image file can be retrieved by any means, such as downloading form a remote location or uncompressing from a file, etc. Returned file will be handled by the callee of this method. If a temporary file is created copying the contents of the original texture (or modifying such texture by transcoding it or resizing it), then it will be the responsibility of the callee to delete the temporary file.
      Parameters:
      writer - reference to writer.
      texture - reference to texture.
      Returns:
      File containing texture to be validated.

    • onDidValidateTexture

      void onDidValidateTexture(MeshWriter writer, File f)
      Called when texture has been validated. This method is called so that the callee has a chance to remove the texture file if needed.
      Parameters:
      writer - reference to writer.
      f - reference to texture file that has been validated. If this file was meant to be temporary, this method gives a chance to remove it because it will no longer be needed.

    • onTextureReceived

      File onTextureReceived(MeshWriter writer, int textureWidth, int textureHeight)
      Called when texture data is found in a binary file. This method should create a temporary file where such data will be copied to.
      Parameters:
      writer - reference to writer.
      textureWidth - texture image width in pixels.
      textureHeight - texture image height in pixels.
      Returns:
      File where texture data will be copied to.

    • onTextureDataAvailable

      File onTextureDataAvailable(MeshWriter writer, File textureFile, int textureWidth, int textureHeight)
      Called when texture data of a binary file has been copied to temporal file and is available for processing. This method gives the callee a chance to transcode, transform or resize the texture image as needed.
      Parameters:
      writer - reference to writer.
      textureFile - file that contains texture image data read from stream.
      textureWidth - texture image width in pixels.
      textureHeight - texture image height in pixels.
      Returns:
      converted image trans-coded into JPG format or resized if needed, otherwise textureFile can be returned if no changes are needed.

    • onTextureDataProcessed

      void onTextureDataProcessed(MeshWriter writer, File textureFile, int textureWidth, int textureHeight)
      Called when texture data has already been processed for a binary file. This method gives a chance to remove any temporal texture image as it will no longer be needed.
      Parameters:
      writer - reference to writer.
      textureFile - file that contains texture image data that can be removed.
      textureWidth - texture image width in pixels.
      textureHeight - texture image height in pixels.
